ws.rocket.path.meta.http.cache

Interface Modifiable


  • public interface Modifiable
    Declares an object as modifiable with a date property indicating the last modified time-stamp.

    A request handler that reaches this target object can optionally implement support for following HTTP headers:

    • Last-Modified (in response)
    • If-Modified-Since (in request)
    • If-Unmodified-Since (in request)
    • Date (in response; recommended for keeping time consistent with Last-Modified)
    The handler may also provide additional cache control headers.

    Using HTTP caching, applications can reduce network traffic and server load while improving end-user browsing experience. However, caching must be well-thought before used. For example, dynamic queries must not be cached. On the other hand, caching suggestions should be included in the response to avoid unexpected default behaviour of user-agents (e.g. browsers).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Date getLastModified()
      Provides the last modified date of the resource contained by this object.

    • Method Detail

      • getLastModified

        java.util.Date getLastModified()
        Provides the last modified date of the resource contained by this object.

        When this method returns null then caching headers by last modified date must be omitted.

        Returns:
        A date object or null.
